title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he was not rooting for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, stirring fan reactions.
Ahead of the game, Brady expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, reversing his earlier stance.
Brady faced criticism from former teammates like Vince Wilfork for not publicly supporting the Patriots initially.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Debate continues over NFL MVP decision, with calls for Patriots' Drake Maye over Rams' Matthew Stafford.
Jeff Saturday and Mina Kimes support Maye, citing his dual-threat abilities and fewer resources compared to Stafford.
Maye led Patriots to 6-0 against common opponents with Rams, outperforming Stafford in key stats like QBR and first downs.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Pressure on Seahawks QB Sam Darnold is pivotal for Patriots success in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium.
Patriots QB Drake Maye might exploit Seahawks' vulnerability to scrambling quarterbacks to counter their strong defense.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane's ankle injury could impact their ability to contain Seahawks RB Kenneth Walker.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Quarterback Drake Maye expected to play in Super Bowl, showing no injury concerns after practicing fully.
Patriots linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are questionable for the Super Bowl due to knee and ankle injuries.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer listed as questionable with a hamstring injury, despite full practice participation.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' is streaming on Netflix, featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster in a Western-themed heist film.
'Splitsville' is a romantic comedy streaming on Hulu, starring Kyle Marvin, Michael Angelo Covino, Adria Arjona, and Dakota Johnson.
The 2026 Winter Olympics coverage is available on Peacock, with live and tape-delayed options for viewers.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' motivates New England community and Patriots team.
New England Patriots unexpectedly reached Super Bowl LX after a failed last season, spurred by Diggs's leadership.
Stefon Diggs faces assault charges but remains influential in Patriots' Super Bowl journey at age 32.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise funds for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund.
Funds raised will support Emergency Response, Cancer Care & Research, and the Home Base Program for veterans.
Demeris, a North Attleboro resident, is inspired by personal connections to emergency services, cancer care, and military support.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets in South End is closing in June after 28 years; the decision is due to costly upgrades.
Croft School, initially set to take over the space, withdrew after community opposition to losing retail space.
A Change.org petition against the closure's impact on the community gained over 1,500 signatures, urging preservation.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The @DrakeMayeLover Instagram account, created in May 2024, has nearly 400,000 followers and over 1,000 posts.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye acknowledged the account, which posts memes and sells merchandise dedicated to him.
The account's anonymous owner plans to reveal their identity after meeting and getting a photo with Drake Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady's neutral stance on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup disappointed some Patriots fans.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers expressed divided opinions on Brady's comments, from disappointment to understanding.
Brady's comments were framed as a new chapter aligning with his broadcasting career and Raiders ownership.
